note.p: Career: MP for Rye (1789-1796); Joint Secretary of the Treasury (1791-1801); MP for Midhurst (1796-1802); a Director of Greenwich Hospital (1799-1829); Privy Councillor (1802); MP for Wendover (1802-1806); Lord of the Treasury (1804-1806); MP for Haslemere (1806-1826); Joint Paymaster General (1807-1817);Trustee of the British Museum (1812); sole Paymaster General (1817-1826); an original Trustee of the National Gallery
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1838 No 35 p 94
